intro: Cochlearia saxifragifolia, commonly known as the saxifrageleaf cochlearia, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Brassicaceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a raceme. Native to the British Isles, this plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats. It has hairy, linear leaves and is often found in calcareous soils. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
